metadata.title: CVE-2021-26934 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - negligible
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel 4.18 through 5.10.16, as usedby Xen. The backend allocation (aka be-alloc) mode of the drm_xen_frontdrivers was not meant to be a supported configuration, but this wasn'tstated accordingly in its support status entry.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-26934` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').

linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1098.105').
